description:
Join us for an Open Day at Barham Park Studios, where we'll be launching our new Flourish Zine by local artists and families which shows the Park in a new light, and introducing the Artist in Residence for 2024-25.

We'll also be opening the doors of our historic studios to share a snapshot of the amazing work made by our diverse community of artists.

Refreshments will be available to all!

events.name: Drop in: Barham Park Open Studios
events.notes: Artists studios and communal space will be open from 12-4pm.

events.name: Drop in: Barham Park Flourish Zine self-led tour
events.notes: Grab a copy of our new Zine and tour the beautiful historic grounds of Barham Park at your own pace using our self-guided tour.

events.name: Drop in: Guided tour of our building
events.notes: We'll show you around our communal spaces and artist studios.

factsheet.heading: ACAVA Opens: Barham Park 2024
paragraphs: Join us for an Open Day at Barham Park Studios, where we'll be launching our new Flourish Zine by local artists and families which shows the Park in a new light, and introducing the Artist in Residence for 2024.
We'll also be opening the doors of our historic studios to share a snapshot of the amazing work made by our diverse community of 31 artists.

factsheet.heading: Why Barham Park?
paragraphs: Barham Park Studios, formerly Crabb's House, is a Georgian-era Mock Tudor building which was renovated in the 20th century, and is now home to 31 artist studios, many of which will be opened up.

Set in Barham Park, which was landscaped in the 18th century, the building is surrounded by manicured ponds & parklands which visitors are also invited to explore in a self-guided tour with our new Zine.

factsheet.heading: A family-friendly tour of Barham Park's historic ground
paragraphs: Visit our Barham Park Open Studios day and celebrate the launch of our new Flourish Zine!

Co-created by local families and artists Nicole Morris & Sadie St. Hilaire as part of ACAVAâ€™s community programme Flourish, the Zine gives visitors of all ages an opportunity to go on a self-led tour and explore the surrounding outdoor environment in a playful, engaging way.

factsheet.heading: About Flourish
paragraphs: Starting in 2017, Flourish is an ongoing school holiday art programme for families in North Kensington and Wembley with primary school-aged children. It offers a space for families to get creative and enjoy learning new skills with professional artists.

factsheet.heading: Refreshments
paragraphs: Free refreshments will be available to all who come visit us!

images.title: Barham Park shot by ACAVA Shoots

location.address: Barham Park Studios, 660 Harrow Road, HA0 2HB
travel_info: Train: Sudbury & Harrow Road, Wembley Central
Additional travel info: Wembley Central is a 20 minute walk away.

name: Barham Park Open Studios
